result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew T Elliott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew T Elliott is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew T Elliott was found guilty of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $268 + $250 DNA surchargeto be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with RDS or any member of her family. No unsupervised contact with juvenile females.

Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample. Sex Offender Registry required. Psych eval to be released to DOC for treatment.

timeConds.notes: W/ Huber. 5 months stayed for sex offender treatment. Credit does not apply.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew T Elliott

Reporter: Ann Albert
  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.
Atty John Tradewell
Preliminary hearing on August 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with R.D.S. or any member of her immediate family.
- Defendant shall not have any contact with female juveniles.
- Defendant shall not be at any movie cinemas or shopping malls.
- Defendant shall not be in Waunakee, WI.
- Cash bail is set at $2500.00 per case. This cash bail shall revert to a signature bond on 8/6/14 at 10:00 AM in the amount of $1000.00 (per case). If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $10,000.00 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
Defendant did not waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge - Br 1

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney State Public Defender.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
